race.name: Giro Sardegna Gravel
race.tagline: Sardinian mountains—130km of island gravel, 2,600m elevation, Mediterranean views, May warmth.

terrain.primary: Sardinian mountains—rolling terrain with coastal views
terrain.surface: 75% gravel, 25% paved roads. Sardinian mountains—rolling terrain, coastal views. 2,600 m over 130 km. Siniscola area. Technical rating: 4/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Giro Sardegna Gravel is Sardinian mountains—130 km, 2,600 m elevation. Founded ~2020. 75% gravel, 25% paved. Sardinian mountains—rolling terrain, Mediterranean coastal views. 500-700 riders. Siniscola, Sardinia (coastal town). May spring conditions (18-28°C). Affordable entry (€90-€130 / $100-$145). If you want Sardinian island gravel with Mediterranean views and affordable entry, this is it. If you need local/domestic, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Giro Sardegna Gravel is Sardinian island mountain adventure. 130 km, 2,600 m, Mediterranean views. If you want Sardinian gravel with stunning scenery and affordable entry, this is it. If you need local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but Sardinia makes it worth it. Post-race food/wine.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Olbia (OLB). Rental car needed (60 km, 1-hour drive to Siniscola). Coastal town lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race May. Post-race Sardinian food/wine.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party with Sardinian food/wine.

course_description.character: 130 km, 2,600 m. 75% gravel, 25% paved. Sardinian mountains—rolling terrain, coastal views. Technical rating: 4/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Sardinian Mountains
suffering_zones.description: Sardinian mountains. 2,600 m cumulative elevation. Rolling terrain.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Low gears. Pace conservatively. Cumulative elevation adds up. 130 km long.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: May Warmth
suffering_zones.description: May Sardinia = 20-28°C. Warm. Sun exposure. Mediterranean heat.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 3+ bottles. Sun protection. Hydrate constantly. Start early. Warmth is manageable.
